Change-Id: I199cba6e5fc9ab4205bba369e6a2f34fc5ce22d4

commit_message:
Use the same key for memcache and env['swift.infocache']

When we were caching directly to the WSGI environment, it made sense to
have different keys for the different caches. Now that we have a
separate data structure for the per-request cache, however, we ought to
be consistent.

Change-Id: I199cba6e5fc9ab4205bba369e6a2f34fc5ce22d4

subject: Remove unnecessary created_at from ORM Message
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-09 17:10:38.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/db/sqlalchemy/models.py'], 'message': 'Remove unnecessary created_at from ORM Message

ORM Message Class inherits from CinderBase, which in turn inherits from
Oslo's TimestampMixin, which means that created_at is already defined
and therefore there is no need to redefine it again.

This patch removes unnecessary "created_at" field from the ORM model.

Change-Id: I58d9d953add77a64836863026b28a94e5c2e9dd1
'}]
commit_message:
Remove unnecessary created_at from ORM Message

ORM Message Class inherits from CinderBase, which in turn inherits from
Oslo's TimestampMixin, which means that created_at is already defined
and therefore there is no need to redefine it again.

This patch removes unnecessary "created_at" field from the ORM model.

Change-Id: I58d9d953add77a64836863026b28a94e5c2e9dd1

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-05-16 16:50:37.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/linux/interface.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/ip_lib.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/dhcp/test_agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/linux/test_ip_lib.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/dhcp.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/linux/test_interface.py'], 'message': "Cleanup orphaned DHCP resources on enable

The current DHCP agent's implementation doesn't perform a complete
check for an existing device when setting up DHCP on a network.
In particular, if a subset of a network's DHCP resources are deleted
out-of-band (ex: namespace), the current check will pass resulting in
a new set of network DHCP resources being created, and the lingering
ones forgotten + orphaned.

Moreover, the existing interface drivers unplug() methods are not
idempotent and thus cannot be used to clean-up linering resources
for a said device; they only succeed when all DHCP resources exist.

This patch addresses the issue by introducing inherrited base logic
allowing lingering resources to be detected and cleaned up with
idempotence in mind. While the same result could be obtained by
adding logic to each driver, this approach reduces the code footprint
as well as duplication.

NB: I do realize this patch is a bit beefy. I'm more than happy to
refector into smaller patches assuming we can get some agreement
that this approach is acceptable.

Change-Id: Ib162510a8d781a027635000c471f42819201a16e
Closes-Bug: #1567049
"}]
commit_message:
Cleanup orphaned DHCP resources on enable

The current DHCP agent's implementation doesn't perform a complete
check for an existing device when setting up DHCP on a network.
In particular, if a subset of a network's DHCP resources are deleted
out-of-band (ex: namespace), the current check will pass resulting in
a new set of network DHCP resources being created, and the lingering
ones forgotten + orphaned.

Moreover, the existing interface drivers unplug() methods are not
idempotent and thus cannot be used to clean-up linering resources
for a said device; they only succeed when all DHCP resources exist.

This patch addresses the issue by introducing inherrited base logic
allowing lingering resources to be detected and cleaned up with
idempotence in mind. While the same result could be obtained by
adding logic to each driver, this approach reduces the code footprint
as well as duplication.

NB: I do realize this patch is a bit beefy. I'm more than happy to
refector into smaller patches assuming we can get some agreement
that this approach is acceptable.

Change-Id: Ib162510a8d781a027635000c471f42819201a16e
Closes-Bug: #1567049

commit_message:
InvalidHostForRebuildNotEnoughVIOS mock needs additional param

The exception being raised as a side effect in a mock now needs
to take a parameter. We'll get an error if the replacement
value is not given.

Change-Id: I6b63a625331772e39a6921cda6eb487193f12dce
Closes-Bug: #1583627

subject: Bump rate for osic to 0.5
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-05-19 13:46:56.000000000', 'files': ['nodepool/nodepool.yaml'], 'message': "Bump rate for osic to 0.5

I've noticed when osic is not under load (empty check / gate pipeline)
we don't leak any FIPs. But once we start putting pressure on osic, we
start leaking FIPs fast.  We still don't know why but as a test, lets
throttle our API calls to see what happens.

Change-Id: I2c0e79f954de0e4ad2a011b168e670d8c0691e12
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Bump rate for osic to 0.5

I've noticed when osic is not under load (empty check / gate pipeline)
we don't leak any FIPs. But once we start putting pressure on osic, we
start leaking FIPs fast.  We still don't know why but as a test, lets
throttle our API calls to see what happens.

Change-Id: I2c0e79f954de0e4ad2a011b168e670d8c0691e12
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
oidc: add OidcToken class to authenticate reusing an access token

Some services or users may have obtained an access token, so it would be
possible to authenticate using this token directly (for example a
service where the user has already logged in). This new class makes
possible to use an access token to authenticate directly with Keystone,
exchanging it for a Keystone token.

Implements: blueprint openid-connect
Change-Id: I4c14a074178c4af23aaee56d0eb26599b292d866

commit_message:
Basic Extension and CRUD for Segments

This patch enables CRUD on Segments by defining a new entity called
'Segment' with an extension definition and some DB code to read the
existing segments DB.  A basic framework for create, update, and
delete are provided.

For now, this is just the basic boiler-plate but I've got to start
somewhere.  It is implemented as a service plugin that is disabled by
default because it has not been fully tested with any plugin.
Follow-on patches will implement support for this new extension in
ML2 and OVN at least.

Change-Id: Ifc370fdd38f9a5b296334635fa85bd93d270b910
Partially-Implements: blueprint routed-networks

commit_message:
[kafka] Add several bootstrap servers support

At that moment kafka driver can use only url with one "host:port"
for the bootstrap server defining, but kafka client supports
set of host:port adresses: "host1:port1,host2:port2", ... .
This patch implement this functional in kafka driver for the better HA.

List self.hostaddrs stores strings "host:port" of Connection.
It collects from self.url.hosts

Change-Id: I5eece66ca6bd069a0df8c8629b4ac815f69a7c7d
Closes-Bug: #1572017

commit_message:
Ignore SendEnv LC_* from ssh clients of master

If ssh client will send his Languange to server. They will be
accepted and in some cases it can cause breaking of python code.
To avoid unintended language settings let's ignore them.

Change-Id: Iabee9ef57244ea37972af16b1315118c349c30ac
Closes-bug: #1573638
(cherry picked from commit 7b904d2f3b4c035cdcf890ea45ab6eb65764a141)

commit_message:
Add support for Storage hooks

This adds support for Juju's storage hooks by merging the config
provided osd-devices with Juju storage provided osd-devices, in the
same way that the existing Ceph charm handles them.

In addition to providing support for ceph-osds via Juju storage,
we provide support for multiple journal devices through Juju storage
as well.

We have to add a shim hook to ensure that Ceph is installed prior
to storage hook invocation because storage attached at deploy time
will execute hooks before the install hook

Change-Id: Idad46e8f4cc32e09fbd64d29cd93745662e9f542

commit_message:
Plugin links handlers now returning 409 on existing url

Previous behaviour allowed to create multiple links with the same url
what was occurring during plugin tasks re-run.

Now 409 error is returned when plugin- or cluster-level link creating
or updating with the non-unique URL value.
Plugin developers should handle such exception by themselves
in plugin tasks.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1538209

Change-Id: I1de1e9f3957cbe11e91cd8cd4806ac1cd714d630

subject: Apply query to highlight query
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-05-16 15:35:33.000000000', 'files': ['searchlight/tests/unit/v1/test_search.py', 'searchlight/api/v1/search.py'], 'message': 'Apply query to highlight query

If not specified, highlighting defaults to attempting to reapply the
entire query to documents successfully matched. Since we apply our RBAC
terms in a filtered_query, the highlighter attempts to include them.

Elasticsearch 2.1 highlights this (pun intended) because highlighting
parent/child queries doesn't work; in ES 1.x it failed silently.
Although the underlying bug for 2.x will likely be fixed (see
https://github.com/elastic/elasticsearch/issues/14999), the behavior is
wrong.

This patch applies the "query" as "highlight_query" to all highlighted
fields, unless a "highlight_query" is already provided.

Change-Id: I665d629456ee4fa20c194e65b38b198ac0861f1d
Closes-Bug: #1570213
'}]
commit_message:
Apply query to highlight query

If not specified, highlighting defaults to attempting to reapply the
entire query to documents successfully matched. Since we apply our RBAC
terms in a filtered_query, the highlighter attempts to include them.

Elasticsearch 2.1 highlights this (pun intended) because highlighting
parent/child queries doesn't work; in ES 1.x it failed silently.
Although the underlying bug for 2.x will likely be fixed (see
https://github.com/elastic/elasticsearch/issues/14999), the behavior is
wrong.

This patch applies the "query" as "highlight_query" to all highlighted
fields, unless a "highlight_query" is already provided.

Change-Id: I665d629456ee4fa20c194e65b38b198ac0861f1d
Closes-Bug: #1570213

subject: Remove unused parameters in OidcPassword methods
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-05-19 08:18:14.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneclient/tests/unit/v3/test_auth_oidc.py', 'keystoneclient/contrib/auth/v3/oidc.py'], 'message': 'Remove unused parameters in OidcPassword methods

Some methods from OidcPassword accepted a parameter to indicate the URL
where a request was to be made:

- _get_keystone_token accepted federated_token_url, the URL for
  federated authentication.
- _get_access_token accepted access_token_endpoint, the URL used to get
  an oidc access token.

However, they were using the object attribute self.access_token_endpoint
and the property self.federated_token_url, therefore they were
completely ignored. This changes remoes them.

Change-Id: I18a5632cf3967228214aa99ec6d07d9bfcab09d8
'}]
commit_message:
Remove unused parameters in OidcPassword methods

Some methods from OidcPassword accepted a parameter to indicate the URL
where a request was to be made:

- _get_keystone_token accepted federated_token_url, the URL for
  federated authentication.
- _get_access_token accepted access_token_endpoint, the URL used to get
  an oidc access token.

However, they were using the object attribute self.access_token_endpoint
and the property self.federated_token_url, therefore they were
completely ignored. This changes remoes them.

Change-Id: I18a5632cf3967228214aa99ec6d07d9bfcab09d8

subject: oidc: create an OidcBase class with common methods
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-05-19 10:37:36.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneclient/tests/unit/v3/test_auth_oidc.py', 'keystoneclient/contrib/auth/v3/oidc.py'], 'message': 'oidc: create an OidcBase class with common methods

OidcPassword defined some methods that can be reused for other OpenID
Connect grant types and authentication flows (like reusing an existing
access token), so lets split the common code into a base class.

This patch is required to support the incoming OidcToken auth plugin.

Partially-Implements: blueprint openid-connect
Change-Id: Ia388023ce86436ebfe583314d308f8ea08d63ca0
'}]
commit_message:
oidc: create an OidcBase class with common methods

OidcPassword defined some methods that can be reused for other OpenID
Connect grant types and authentication flows (like reusing an existing
access token), so lets split the common code into a base class.

This patch is required to support the incoming OidcToken auth plugin.

Partially-Implements: blueprint openid-connect
Change-Id: Ia388023ce86436ebfe583314d308f8ea08d63ca0

commit_message:
Tracking nodes operations in Nodes Table

This patch introduces nodesInProgress Set in nodesReducer instead of
dataOperationInProgress Boolean. nodesInProgress stores uuids of nodes
which have operation going on them. This advantage is used in nodes
table where a checkbox or loader spinner is used depending on whether
node is in operation or available to trigger an operation.

Change-Id: I89afa8bc3b2c55eed38b923408f4a0d98df1e713

commit_message:
Possibility to read OS_ENDPOINT_TYPE (OS_INTERFACE) variable

Rally can create a deployment, using env variables like OS_USERNAME,
OS_PASSWORD, etc. But OS_ENDPOINT_TYPE (OS_INTERFACE) is missing for
some reason. So this patch is intended to fix the issue.

Change-Id: I60a19155d46bbdde2df0a0083512146899fdf178

commit_message:
Make keystone session stickiness optional

As part of Bug 1527717, we added in support of session stickiness for
keystone to allow for federation support in keystone. This introduced
performance issues with keystone and should not be configured by
default. This change disables the stickiness by default but allows for
it to be enabled by adding a 'federation' key to the keystone hiera
hash.

DocImpact: Keystone HAProxy session stickiness can be enabled by adding
a 'federation' key to the keystone hiera configuration. By default
session stickiness is disabled.

Change-Id: Id43446a9f923417b8fa140ffcfddb6797f1b4e48
Related-Bug: #1527717
Closes-Bug: #1582202

disk and place '/boot' on it

Change-Id: I881d9fd4bb378dec78fd86aff0c314c910525110
Closes-bug: 1567450

commit_message:
Move constraints skip from venv to docs env

This was copied from ironic, where we use the 'venv' env for our 'docs'
environment. This isn't the case here, so move the install_command to
the 'docs' env where it actually has an effect.

commit_message:
Set mariadb password at bootstrap

We did not provide MariaDB root password for bootstrap container,
which causes it fail to run. This should fix the problem.

Change-Id: I4a7037d19517b34adda86f3879ce8c39b569edac

subject: Add gate-tempest-dsvm-lvm job to nova's experimental queue
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-13 21:44:10.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/lvm.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/devstack-gate.yaml'], 'message': "Add gate-tempest-dsvm-lvm job to nova's experimental queue

This will help in testing the lvm image backend for the libvirt
driver in Nova while that code is all being refactored.

We don't need it running on all Nova changes, so this puts
it in the experimental queue so it can be run as needed.

This depends on two changes:

1. A devstack change for the LVM_VOLUME_CLEAR variable.

Depends-On: I1e97ba6ab4772a87192ae2689a25050d432358ab

2. A nova change for the lvm blacklist regex of tests.

Depends-On: I90cb85a503f95741b8e4f4f2147798d9414ce4ea

Related to blueprint libvirt-storage-pools

Change-Id: I1ddeb1cc59c590af37d7e5208d61aac0cdf81eff
"}]
commit_message:
Add gate-tempest-dsvm-lvm job to nova's experimental queue

This will help in testing the lvm image backend for the libvirt
driver in Nova while that code is all being refactored.

We don't need it running on all Nova changes, so this puts
it in the experimental queue so it can be run as needed.

This depends on two changes:

1. A devstack change for the LVM_VOLUME_CLEAR variable.

Depends-On: I1e97ba6ab4772a87192ae2689a25050d432358ab

2. A nova change for the lvm blacklist regex of tests.

Depends-On: I90cb85a503f95741b8e4f4f2147798d9414ce4ea

Related to blueprint libvirt-storage-pools

Change-Id: I1ddeb1cc59c590af37d7e5208d61aac0cdf81eff

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-04-29 14:33:08.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_imagebackend.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/imagebackend.py'], 'message': "Add Image.create_from_func

Image.cache() currently has different behaviour for 'generated' disks
and disks created from a glance image. This differing behaviour varies
from backend to backend. For example, it can be seen in the Lvm
backend, which does:

  generated = 'ephemeral_size' in kwargs

i.e. it requires this context but doesn't have it. It gets it by
grepping the arguments to the create function it was passed for an
ephemeral size, and infers the type based on that. The NoBacking
backend uses image_id instead, so it's not even consistent.

The interface is to pass a create function to Image.cache(), and
separately all of the arguments which will eventually be passed to it
if we need to call it.

This new interface makes it explicit to the backend that we are
creating a generated disk by having a separate method for doing this.
We also greatly simplify the calling interface by passing in a lambda
which takes a single argument: the destination path.

This patch also highlights a difference in caching behaviour between
backends: the Qcow2, Rdb, and Ploop backends currently cache function
output, whereas NoBacking and Lvm don't. This should eventually be made
consistent, but this patch explicitly aims to keep the current
behaviour.

Implements: blueprint libvirt-instance-storage

Change-Id: I2a8cc5f94a76d7db5f23109eccb175e66a8436d7
"}]
commit_message:
Add Image.create_from_func

Image.cache() currently has different behaviour for 'generated' disks
and disks created from a glance image. This differing behaviour varies
from backend to backend. For example, it can be seen in the Lvm
backend, which does:

  generated = 'ephemeral_size' in kwargs

i.e. it requires this context but doesn't have it. It gets it by
grepping the arguments to the create function it was passed for an
ephemeral size, and infers the type based on that. The NoBacking
backend uses image_id instead, so it's not even consistent.

The interface is to pass a create function to Image.cache(), and
separately all of the arguments which will eventually be passed to it
if we need to call it.

This new interface makes it explicit to the backend that we are
creating a generated disk by having a separate method for doing this.
We also greatly simplify the calling interface by passing in a lambda
which takes a single argument: the destination path.

This patch also highlights a difference in caching behaviour between
backends: the Qcow2, Rdb, and Ploop backends currently cache function
output, whereas NoBacking and Lvm don't. This should eventually be made
consistent, but this patch explicitly aims to keep the current
behaviour.

Implements: blueprint libvirt-instance-storage

Change-Id: I2a8cc5f94a76d7db5f23109eccb175e66a8436d7

Related-Bug: #1549219

commit_message:
Allow scheduler tasks to request longer wait periods

This change allows a scheduler co-routine to yield an integer n, such
that only every nth call to TaskRunner.step() results in the co-routine
being advanced. We'll be able to use this to selectively slow down
polling of resources where and when we know it doesn't make sense to
poll every second.

Change-Id: Ifc6303524be8e477905546760279027886833617
Related-Bug: #1549219

subject: Update tempest test vars
revisions:
[{'number': 14, 'created': '2016-05-19 12:20:11.000000000', 'files': ['tests/test-prepare-containers.yml', 'tests/test-nova-functional.yml', 'tests/test-vars.yml'], 'message': "Update tempest test vars

This commit does the following:

- removes tempest_git_repo since this is the default in the tempest
  role
- removes tempest_git_dest since this variable is no longer used in
  os_tempest
- adds tempest_venv_tag variable so tempest venv is created in
  /opt/tempest_master instead of /opt/tempest_untagged
- updates tests/test-nova-functional.yml to use {{ tempest_venv_bin }}

NOTE: We also remove the local connection from
test-prepare-containers.yml as we were seeing unexpected behaviour with
this in place (such as the host getting a container's hostname, etc.)

Change-Id: Ifa8de2c962f0bc9c1e6351eac667d4ca95a73757
"}]
commit_message:
Update tempest test vars

This commit does the following:

- removes tempest_git_repo since this is the default in the tempest
  role
- removes tempest_git_dest since this variable is no longer used in
  os_tempest
- adds tempest_venv_tag variable so tempest venv is created in
  /opt/tempest_master instead of /opt/tempest_untagged
- updates tests/test-nova-functional.yml to use {{ tempest_venv_bin }}

NOTE: We also remove the local connection from
test-prepare-containers.yml as we were seeing unexpected behaviour with
this in place (such as the host getting a container's hostname, etc.)

Change-Id: Ifa8de2c962f0bc9c1e6351eac667d4ca95a73757

subject: Move files from mount points to actual file systems
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3009, 'name': 'Vladimir Kozhukalov', 'email': 'kozhukalov@gmail.com', 'username': 'kozhukalov'}, {'_account_id': 8003, 'name': 'Aleksandr Gordeev', 'email': 'agordeev@mirantis.com', 'username': 'agordeev'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9977, 'name': 'Aleksandra Fedorova', 'email': 'lp@bookwar.info', 'username': 'afedorova'}, {'_account_id': 13505, 'name': 'Igor Belikov', 'email': 'mail@igorbelikov.com', 'username': 'ibelikov'}, {'_account_id': 14200, 'name': 'Maksim Malchuk', 'email': 'maksim.malchuk@gmail.com', 'username': 'mmalchuk'}, {'_account_id': 19234, 'name': 'Alexey Stupnikov', 'email': 'aleksey.stupnikov@gmail.com', 'username': 'astupnikov'}, {'_account_id': 20656, 'name': 'Fuel Packaging CI', 'email': 'ci+fuel-packaging@mirantis.com', 'username': 'fuel-packaging-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-05-19 10:18:35.000000000', 'files': ['fuel_agent/tests/test_manager.py', 'fuel_agent/utils/fs.py', 'fuel_agent/tests/test_fs_utils.py', 'fuel_agent/manager.py'], 'message': "Move files from mount points to actual file systems

The thing is that sometimes we have file system images and mount
point hierachies which are not aligned. Let's say, we have root
file system image, while partition scheme says that two file
systems should be created on the node: / and /var. In this case
root image has /var directory with a set of files. Obviously, we
need to move all these files from /var directory on the root
file system to /var file system because /var directory will be
used as mount point.
In order to achieve this we mount all existent file systems into
a flat set of temporary directories. We then try to find
specific paths which correspond to mount points and move all
files from these paths to corresponding file systems.

Co-Authored-By: Alexey Stupnikov <astupnikov@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: I1aa7523055ac4bcf6f8a93e9740ccf652ed35cc1
Closes-Bug: #1537699
(cherry picked from commit 5809a3fea96b76386ddc4ccd367c21c00aa8337d)
"}]
commit_message:
Move files from mount points to actual file systems

The thing is that sometimes we have file system images and mount
point hierachies which are not aligned. Let's say, we have root
file system image, while partition scheme says that two file
systems should be created on the node: / and /var. In this case
root image has /var directory with a set of files. Obviously, we
need to move all these files from /var directory on the root
file system to /var file system because /var directory will be
used as mount point.
In order to achieve this we mount all existent file systems into
a flat set of temporary directories. We then try to find
specific paths which correspond to mount points and move all
files from these paths to corresponding file systems.

Co-Authored-By: Alexey Stupnikov <astupnikov@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: I1aa7523055ac4bcf6f8a93e9740ccf652ed35cc1
Closes-Bug: #1537699
(cherry picked from commit 5809a3fea96b76386ddc4ccd367c21c00aa8337d)

subject: Honor $DIB_DEFAULT_INSTALLTYPE in puppet-modules
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-18 19:11:44.000000000', 'files': ['elements/puppet-modules/environment.d/02-puppet-modules-install-types.sh'], 'message': 'Honor $DIB_DEFAULT_INSTALLTYPE in puppet-modules

Makes the puppet-modules element honor the $DIB_DEFAULT_INSTALLTYPE
environment variable. This environment variable is set to source by
default.

Other elements, such as the enable-packages-install element may set it
to package.

Since the enable-packages-install element sets it to package at
01-export-install-types.bash[1], 01-puppet-modules-install-types.sh is
moved to 02-puppet-modules-install-types.sh so that it runs later.

Closes-Bug: 1583263
[1] https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-image-elements/blob/master/elements/enable-packages-install/environment.d/01-export-install-types.bash

Change-Id: I1d14fc9b113d45e7ab613f44011f442e4436a904
'}]
commit_message:
Honor $DIB_DEFAULT_INSTALLTYPE in puppet-modules

Makes the puppet-modules element honor the $DIB_DEFAULT_INSTALLTYPE
environment variable. This environment variable is set to source by
default.

Other elements, such as the enable-packages-install element may set it
to package.

Since the enable-packages-install element sets it to package at
01-export-install-types.bash[1], 01-puppet-modules-install-types.sh is
moved to 02-puppet-modules-install-types.sh so that it runs later.

Closes-Bug: 1583263
[1] https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-image-elements/blob/master/elements/enable-packages-install/environment.d/01-export-install-types.bash

Change-Id: I1d14fc9b113d45e7ab613f44011f442e4436a904

commit_message:
Make neutronapi get_floating*() methods return objects

This makes the neutronapi module return NeutronFloatingIP objects from
the relevant methods, instead of bare dicts.

Note that the API is returning string floating ip identifiers when neutron
is in use, as opposed to the integer ones returned when nova-network is in
use. This patch does not address that problem, but uses the new
NeutronFloatingIP.

Needed for blueprint rm-object-dict-compat-newton

Co-Authored-By: Ryan Rossiter <rlrossit@us.ibm.com>
Change-Id: Ie60fb8661195eec9c01a57129efe8145504789e1

commit_message:
Add bootable disk node flag

Adding this flag to specified disk allows user to choose bootable disk
from Fuel UI and CLi.

This change is very important for deployments with multipath connected
block devices. Mainly, it is because, order of disks in UI can change
easly in this case, so we need introduce to user a possibility to
choose bootable disk explicitly.

Change-Id: I22ffe9104d2ec5a6598d496691fffa0087111070
Partial-Bug: #1567450

subject: Setup rsync module per object server drive
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-18 08:22:58.000000000', 'files': ['templates/object-server-replicator.conf.j2', 'templates/rsyncd.conf.j2', 'defaults/main.yml', 'tasks/swift_pre_install.yml', 'templates/object-server.conf.j2', 'releasenotes/notes/swift-rsync-module-per-drive-79b05af8276e7d6e.yaml'], 'message': 'Setup rsync module per object server drive

This PR sets up rsync module per drive for swift object servers. This
improves resource distribution, and also allows us to utilise rsync
module changes to prevent disk writes to specific drives when they begin
filling up.

Enable this option by setting "swift_rsync_module_per_drive: True", this
will still default to False to match upstream defaults. Additionally the
rsync max connections has been increased to match upstream defaults.

Additionally we include rsync.d/*.conf files by default and set this
directory up, so that we can add individual configuration to disable
specific drives.

Change-Id: I2019cade5bf5f2878497d30ce738dff07786fa64
(cherry picked from commit 53027de8c8e89b9611d1f61102fbe73f6eb1c100)
'}]
commit_message:
Setup rsync module per object server drive

This PR sets up rsync module per drive for swift object servers. This
improves resource distribution, and also allows us to utilise rsync
module changes to prevent disk writes to specific drives when they begin
filling up.

Enable this option by setting "swift_rsync_module_per_drive: True", this
will still default to False to match upstream defaults. Additionally the
rsync max connections has been increased to match upstream defaults.

Additionally we include rsync.d/*.conf files by default and set this
directory up, so that we can add individual configuration to disable
specific drives.

Change-Id: I2019cade5bf5f2878497d30ce738dff07786fa64
(cherry picked from commit 53027de8c8e89b9611d1f61102fbe73f6eb1c100)

commit_message:
Updated role using the Multi-Distro framework

* The default apt packages have been moved into a var file
  that is only loaded when the detected OS is matched.
* The Install task file has had the apt specific tasks moved
  into a named install task file.
* The iptables checksum fix script is now conditional on the distro
* The creation of the upstart scripts is now dependent on distro version
* LBaaS scripts location can be updated based on the distro version

Implements: blueprint multi-platform-host

Change-Id: I5d19fa31ce359fc7e0d40c481e231133fd518ecb
Signed-off-by: Jean-Philippe Evrard <jean-philippe.evrard@rackspace.co.uk>

commit_message:
Fixes invalid uuid usages in functional tests

oslo_versionedobjects.fields.UUIDField will validate UUID in next major
release. So need fix invalid uuid usage before moving to new major
release of oslo.versionedobjects.

Releted-Bug: #1557378
Change-Id: I1dc56cbec42cc385a87886c63f4cf33b68397a29

commit_message:
Fix invalid uuid warnings

Currently, unit testcases emit FutureWarnings from oslo.versionedobjects
about invalid uuids as documented here[1].

This commit changes these tests to use valid uuids so
that when they are run these warnings are no longer emitted.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.versionedobjects/api/fields.html#oslo_versionedobjects.fields.UUIDField

Closes-Bug: #1557378
Change-Id: I21a60e916e183f7c0fc6193d4b7caa88ae3b6d56

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-05-16 18:33:23.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/test_nova_manage.py', 'nova/cmd/manage.py'], 'message': "Remove marker from nova-manage cells_v2 map_instances UI

For a better user experience let's do the right thing. If no max-count
is passed in that means looping through all instances in batches, and if
max-count is used we store a marker to be used for later calls.

Because the marker is the last instance mapped there's already an entry
for that UUID in the instance_mappings table. In order to satisfy the
unique constraint on that column the marker UUID is modified by
replacing '-' with ' ' so that it can be transformed back when needed.

Change-Id: I921258d59e3054cbe874cab96cc8cc47c9a24845
"}]
commit_message:
Remove marker from nova-manage cells_v2 map_instances UI

For a better user experience let's do the right thing. If no max-count
is passed in that means looping through all instances in batches, and if
max-count is used we store a marker to be used for later calls.

Because the marker is the last instance mapped there's already an entry
for that UUID in the instance_mappings table. In order to satisfy the
unique constraint on that column the marker UUID is modified by
replacing '-' with ' ' so that it can be transformed back when needed.

Change-Id: I921258d59e3054cbe874cab96cc8cc47c9a24845

If an allowed_address_pair port associated with a FloatingIP

Hence the DVR will be able to deploy the FloatingIP for

Closes-Bug: #1445255

commit_message:
[WIP] DVR: Handle unbound allowed_address_pair port with FIP

If an allowed_address_pair port associated with a FloatingIP
is configured to a service_port, the allowed_address_pair port
should inherit the service_ports host binding and device
owner if device_owner is not configured.

Hence the DVR will be able to deploy the FloatingIP for
the provided allowed_address_pair.

In this case if the associated port's admin state changes,
the allowed_address_pairs device_owner and host binding will
be reverted back to None.

When associated service port is deleted the allowed_address_
pairs device_owner and host binding will be reverted as well.

Change-Id: I362468f1658beea237f480ba62ca96294fb0f557
Closes-Bug: #1445255

[{'number': 18, 'created': '2016-05-17 16:46:49.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/test_plugin.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/db/test_db_base_plugin_v2.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/l2pop/test_mech_driver.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/extensions/test_l3.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/extensions/test_dns_integration.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/ipam/drivers/neutrondb_ipam/test_driver.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/test_securitygroups_rpc.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/db/test_ipam_pluggable_backend.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/extensions/test_dns.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/extensions/test_extraroute.py'], 'message': "Ensure unit tests don't assume an IP address allocation strategy

These unit tests initially asserted sequential allocation of IP
addresses, even though they have no need to specifically assert
that a specific IP was allocated. This made it difficult to
change out the IP allocation algorithm in the future and made
these tests fragile and poorly isolated.

This change breaks the dependency these unit tests have on a
specific IP allocation strategy and isolates them from any
changes that may be made to the order in which IP addresses
are allocated on a subnet.

Change-Id: Idc879b7f1e6496aa96b4f7ae6c3eaca6079bdcac
Partial-Bug: #1543094
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure unit tests don't assume an IP address allocation strategy

These unit tests initially asserted sequential allocation of IP
addresses, even though they have no need to specifically assert
that a specific IP was allocated. This made it difficult to
change out the IP allocation algorithm in the future and made
these tests fragile and poorly isolated.

This change breaks the dependency these unit tests have on a
specific IP allocation strategy and isolates them from any
changes that may be made to the order in which IP addresses
are allocated on a subnet.

Change-Id: Idc879b7f1e6496aa96b4f7ae6c3eaca6079bdcac
Partial-Bug: #1543094

commit_message:
Port RabbitMQ OCF script from 8.0 to 6.x

This commit picks the current state of 8.0 into 6.1 Below are listed
added commits. Several commits were ported not fully because of
their unimportance. Such commits are marked in the list. Most of them
are non-functional as a result and are needed only to make current
script to be full copy of the one in 8.0 branch.

* Fix chowning for rabbit OCF
  (b5ae83a15be191d46d4b0da3d4bc67420311896a)

* Fix error return codes for rabbit OCF
  (5097d94f5d56fd6126ca9b7c1227961536c94399)

* Implement the dumping of rabbitMQ definitions
  The commit has only RabbitMQ OCF part ported. The commit has
  no effect as a result.
  (8ccdfc62152de8212ba6a0aeed45c1e3677c70a4)

* Fix rabbitmq data restore for large datasets
  (11c4e4c3985949f776367dd5045102c6398aef89)

* Add more logs to rabbitmq get_status function
  (60d5743c41999a43d87374357866cd3c3c02aa64)

* Return NOT_RUNNING when beam is not RUNNING
  (00f28b5cc48bdba389922fa460e4a6e6e173589e)

* Wait for rabbitmq sync before stop/demote actions
  (9ca5b6709cd18c8134cd8feaccf937ef49a625b4)

* Sync rabbitmq OCF from upstream
  (fe4edc4589ff37647134fdf83fc4e8896469cdd7)

* Fix the timeout arg for the su_rabbit_cmd

commit_message:
Name and AZ should as be optional param on aggregate-update

'name' should be an optional parameter not required
on aggregate-update, so we can update 'availability_zone' only.

commit_message:
Remove FWaaS vendor drivers

The only sections of the FWaaS codebase that are truly broken due to the
decoupling of FWaaS from the L3 agent are the varmour driver/agent.  I
propose a temporary deletion of the varmour drivers until we have our
house in order, at which time we can re-add them in a more orderly
fashion.

This also removes the cisco, mcafee, and vyatta drivers and the vyatta
agent, since those were determined to be removed some time ago.

Change-Id: I7094c4473b0396ba5e4d9685d81ac15c2c977691

subject: Defer radosgw key provision until OSD's detected
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-05-19 07:54:54.000000000', 'files': ['hooks/ceph_hooks.py', 'templates/ceph.conf'], 'message': "Defer radosgw key provision until OSD's detected

The RADOS gateway on startup will try to initialize a number
of pools in the Ceph cluster; if no OSD's are present at the
point of startup, this operation is re-tried for a period of
5 minutes.

As ceph-radosgw and ceph-mon are typically deployed in LXC
containers, they are up and running before ceph-osd units
are fully operational, resulting in ceph-radosgw units with
no running radosgw process.

By deferring the provision of keys to related ceph-radosgw
units until ceph-osd units are detected, the chance of this
race happening is greatly reduced.

Also add trailing space to ceph.conf as ceph requires that
configuration files end with a newline.

Change-Id: I2a21f021502bde5c688bd3ac4b84ef24a8bdef68
Closes-Bug: 1577519
Closes-Bug: 1578403
"}]
commit_message:
Defer radosgw key provision until OSD's detected

The RADOS gateway on startup will try to initialize a number
of pools in the Ceph cluster; if no OSD's are present at the
point of startup, this operation is re-tried for a period of
5 minutes.

As ceph-radosgw and ceph-mon are typically deployed in LXC
containers, they are up and running before ceph-osd units
are fully operational, resulting in ceph-radosgw units with
no running radosgw process.

By deferring the provision of keys to related ceph-radosgw
units until ceph-osd units are detected, the chance of this
race happening is greatly reduced.

Also add trailing space to ceph.conf as ceph requires that
configuration files end with a newline.

Change-Id: I2a21f021502bde5c688bd3ac4b84ef24a8bdef68
Closes-Bug: 1577519
Closes-Bug: 1578403

commit_message:
Revert "Remove Ceilometer tempest tests"

Some gates (Puppet OpenStack) are still running the tests in stable/liberty.
While Liberty is not EOL, it would be great to keep those tests, since Ceilometer does not provide in-tree tests in Liberty (only since Mitaka).

This reverts commit e4796f8de446aaaafa83902d1fb2d613331436cf.

Change-Id: Iad27031b2912f5f1eebdbe82efb0230f8442d395

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-19 07:54:18.000000000', 'files': ['hooks/ceph_hooks.py', 'templates/ceph.conf'], 'message': "Limit OSD object name lengths for Jewel + ext4

As of the Ceph Jewel release, certain limitations apply to
OSD object name lengths: specifically if ext4 is in use for
block devices or a directory based OSD is configured, OSD's
must be configured to limit object name length:

  osd max object name len = 256
  osd max object namespace len = 64

This may cause problems storing objects with long names via
the ceph-radosgw charm or for direct users of RADOS.

Also ensure that ceph.conf as a final newline as ceph requires
this.

Change-Id: I99447232bd002116f1f5822f1cf872984f79ef81
Closes-Bug: 1580320
Closes-Bug: 1578403
"}]
commit_message:
Limit OSD object name lengths for Jewel + ext4

As of the Ceph Jewel release, certain limitations apply to
OSD object name lengths: specifically if ext4 is in use for
block devices or a directory based OSD is configured, OSD's
must be configured to limit object name length:

  osd max object name len = 256
  osd max object namespace len = 64

This may cause problems storing objects with long names via
the ceph-radosgw charm or for direct users of RADOS.

Also ensure that ceph.conf as a final newline as ceph requires
this.

Change-Id: I99447232bd002116f1f5822f1cf872984f79ef81
Closes-Bug: 1580320
Closes-Bug: 1578403

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-05-10 15:34:20.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': 'Reorder DB API require_context decorators

In some cases, the context is checked after doing other
operations.

As this is something enforcing a security boundary,
we really want to check context before anything else,
and fail immediately, to mitigate anything that could
go wrong in the other decorators.  So, ensure the
context checks run first.

This also removes an extra volume_get() for
volume_admin_metadata_update() which was loading the volume
twice.

Change-Id: Ia6432de766b22e80e337b67a994cdb921ea14cc6
'}]
commit_message:
Reorder DB API require_context decorators

In some cases, the context is checked after doing other
operations.

As this is something enforcing a security boundary,
we really want to check context before anything else,
and fail immediately, to mitigate anything that could
go wrong in the other decorators.  So, ensure the
context checks run first.

This also removes an extra volume_get() for
volume_admin_metadata_update() which was loading the volume
twice.

Change-Id: Ia6432de766b22e80e337b67a994cdb921ea14cc6

commit_message:
Switch to oslo log

* configured using puppet oslo module instead of manual configuration
* update the metadata.json with the dependency
* remove verbose from logging
  This option is deprecated in Mitaka and has been removed in Newton
  ref: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/314573/

Change-Id: Iea4e4470abd58b09b6a136c3757624ba0d941a90

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-19 11:12:43.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/lxc_cache_preparation.yml'], 'message': "Fix of the delegation for the lxc caching

Currently the lxc caching process delegates the copy from the local host
to the deployed node. If the localhost isn't a lxc node, the content
will not be correct. This changes the delegation to the appropriate
lxc node.

Change-Id: I6fb23a7d3986c2eb5195ad0d64c4cba38b90a05b
Signed-off-by: Jean-Philippe Evrard <jean-philippe.evrard@rackspace.co.uk>
"}]
commit_message:
Fix of the delegation for the lxc caching

Currently the lxc caching process delegates the copy from the local host
to the deployed node. If the localhost isn't a lxc node, the content
will not be correct. This changes the delegation to the appropriate
lxc node.

Change-Id: I6fb23a7d3986c2eb5195ad0d64c4cba38b90a05b
Signed-off-by: Jean-Philippe Evrard <jean-philippe.evrard@rackspace.co.uk>

commit_message:
Resync stable charm-helpers

Avoid use of 'service --status-all' which is currently
broken on trusty for upstart managed daemons; the change
moves to detecting how the daemon is managed, and then
using upstart status XXX or the return code of service XXX
status to determine whether a process is running.

Fixes for IPv6 network address detection under Ubuntu
16.04 which changes the output format of the ip commands
slightly.

Update the version map to include 8.1.x as a Neutron
version for Mitaka.

Change-Id: I51618d881e3618e17a355de94ba8a17bfc07f336
Closes-Bug: 1581171
Closes-Bug: 1581598
Closes-Bug: 1580674

commit_message:
Resync stable charm-helpers

Avoid use of 'service --status-all' which is currently
broken on trusty for upstart managed daemons; the change
moves to detecting how the daemon is managed, and then
using upstart status XXX or the return code of service XXX
status to determine whether a process is running.

Fixes for IPv6 network address detection under Ubuntu
16.04 which changes the output format of the ip commands
slightly.

Update the version map to include 8.1.x as a Neutron
version for Mitaka.

Change-Id: I1d564acd33f7e085a708f85d57cdad25ca6d73d4
Closes-Bug: 1581171
Closes-Bug: 1581598
Closes-Bug: 1580674

commit_message:
Create separate task for uploading Murano package

When we have enabled Glare for Murano, Core library package will
be uploaded to current Glance backend - Swift or RadosGW - hence
we must be sure that both already prepared and ready to use.

Change-Id: If0a684aa9b0410e28a82b1501633c0ebdb64dc67
Closes-bug: #1572785
(cherry picked from commit e8dd56f5f8ac639ebfef95c151225bc408ed2be2)

commit_message:
Add exception type to stop trace info

This patch adds the exception type name to stop trace info.
Using this info, it will be easier to identify the methods/
APIs which failed.

commit_message:
Remove duplicate 'default_log_levels' declaration

Duplicate declaration 'default_log_levels' for the '::nova::logging'
produces an issue when nova-compute logs not created on the compute
nodes in case the 'debug' option is enabled during deployment. This
commit removes this duplication because it already declared in the
globals. Also, this commit contains some styling cleanups.

Closes-Bug: #1579072
Change-Id: Id24d742a6c7d9f1240bba7991959119d19084e94
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <mmalchuk@mirantis.com>
(cherry picked from commit f989647cc5e6cb4a17db57f5c5d82eb92676efd7)

subject: Increase status report messages time resolution
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4715, 'name': 'Angus Salkeld', 'email': 'asalkeld@redhat.com', 'username': 'asalkeld'}, {'_account_id': 7225, 'name': 'Serg Melikyan', 'email': 'smelikyan@mirantis.com', 'username': 'smelikyan'}, {'_account_id': 7226, 'name': 'Stan Lagun', 'email': 'stan.lagun@gmail.com', 'username': 'istalker2'}, {'_account_id': 7535, 'name': 'Nikolay Starodubtsev', 'email': 'starodubcevna@gmail.com', 'username': 'Kezar'}, {'_account_id': 7821, 'name': 'Murano CI', 'username': 'murano-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 12597, 'name': 'Lin Yang', 'email': 'lin.a.yang@intel.com', 'username': 'lin.yang'}, {'_account_id': 15168, 'name': 'Kirill Zaitsev', 'email': 'k.zaitsev@me.com', 'username': 'kzaitsev'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 14, 'created': '2016-05-19 01:31:56.000000000', 'files': ['murano/engine/system/status_reporter.py', 'murano/db/migration/alembic_migrations/versions/014_increase_status_time_resolution.py'], 'message': 'Increase status report messages time resolution

We use DATETIME SQL type for created/updated columns
everywhere through the database. In SQL standard
DATETIME defaults to DATETIME(6) which is 6 digit
fraction second part. However MySQL defaults it
to DATETIME(0) for backward compatibility. In result
status messages timestamps get rounded to the
second boundary and if there are several status
messages were generated within a second
after table sort they might be shown in a different
order.

This commit adds MySQL migration that increases
resolution for the status table and adds subseconds
to the generated status repor timestamps.

Change-Id: Ice8c2d82c6a320c7f73c27f4c60c87bef55b8d95
Related-Bug: #1462270
'}]
commit_message:
Increase status report messages time resolution

We use DATETIME SQL type for created/updated columns
everywhere through the database. In SQL standard
DATETIME defaults to DATETIME(6) which is 6 digit
fraction second part. However MySQL defaults it
to DATETIME(0) for backward compatibility. In result
status messages timestamps get rounded to the
second boundary and if there are several status
messages were generated within a second
after table sort they might be shown in a different
order.

This commit adds MySQL migration that increases
resolution for the status table and adds subseconds
to the generated status repor timestamps.

Change-Id: Ice8c2d82c6a320c7f73c27f4c60c87bef55b8d95
Related-Bug: #1462270

commit_message:
Emit notifications when bay operations get executed

Magnum needs to emit notifications for resource tracking, monitoring,
metering and auditing purposes so ceilometer can capture the events
and generate samples.

This commit leverage oslo.notify to send notifications when bay
resource operations are executed.

Change-Id: I4b07539822a75c069d9da8932dc0ff10a02e0058
Partially-Implements: blueprint magnum-notifications

commit_message:
Enable plugin to indicate if it supports L3

Provide a new variable that enables the plugin to indicate
that it supports l3 functionality.

This is due to the fact that plugins do not need l3 agents to provide
l3 support

Closes-bug: 1582119
Change-Id: I9acde86af149cb96d65b493bb99e0561fb5d1b2e

commit_message:
tempest_plugin: drop telemetry decorator

Since [1], 'telemetry' service does not exist and Tempest plugin is now
broken:

InvalidServiceTag: Invalid service tag
Details: telemetry is not a valid service

This patch update the test_object_storage_telemetry_middleware test to
match with the Tempest cleanup.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/tempest/commit/e4796f8de446aaaafa83902d1fb2d613331436cf

Change-Id: I2ae71b722826a4e377a4926c943d1dbce3b1ed9f
(cherry picked from commit aa32401c32ab41ec202ab8a440e22046e8c827c4)

commit_message:
agentnotifiers: retried notifications refactor

This patch introduces retry(func, max_attempts) method
which wraps the original func in such a way,
that if execution results in MessagingException,
the given function will be retried for max_attempts
till success or MessagingException is raised.
The function is in the utils module and can be reused
by different agentnotifiers if necessary.

Change-Id: I0d0c17e500e44c1a17438c29a0e76a9ef00872e8

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-05 03:02:54.000000000', 'files': ['nova/compute/rpcapi.py'], 'message': 'Make compute rpcapi 'live_migration' backward compatible

This commit[1] added compute rpcapi version 4.2 which introduced a new
argument 'migration' when calling 'live_migration' method, but the code
did not ensure the backward compatibility with older version compute
node.

When calling 'live_migration' method with 'migration' argument on older
version(like Kilo) of nova compute node, a "TypeError: live_migration()
got an unexpected keyword argument 'migration'" will be threw up.

[1]https://github.com/openstack/nova/commit/2f4e64a7cf81de4a22fe2fc4210b1f795b1a3db4

Change-Id: I7c453899fd6721c88d7c9d65b727745b499adc9a
Closes-Bug: #1576048
'}]
commit_message:
Make compute rpcapi 'live_migration' backward compatible

This commit[1] added compute rpcapi version 4.2 which introduced a new
argument 'migration' when calling 'live_migration' method, but the code
did not ensure the backward compatibility with older version compute
node.

When calling 'live_migration' method with 'migration' argument on older
version(like Kilo) of nova compute node, a "TypeError: live_migration()
got an unexpected keyword argument 'migration'" will be threw up.

[1]https://github.com/openstack/nova/commit/2f4e64a7cf81de4a22fe2fc4210b1f795b1a3db4

Change-Id: I7c453899fd6721c88d7c9d65b727745b499adc9a
Closes-Bug: #1576048

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-18 08:48:29.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/manifests/globals/globals.pp'], 'message': "Change logic for setting murano_hash for plugins

Fuel-web changes I8ebac4405a1eaede18a35acbbab7b202b6aac754 and
Ieaa373d52403b834aa17eeb05a70b37c61454ad0 changed location for
'murano_glance_artifacts_plugin' setting. It has been moved
from the 'additional_components' group to the 'murano_settings'
group, hence we need update library as well.

The most easier way is to change logic for setting murano_hash in
global task, then we don't need to change modular task at all.

Change-Id: I4af71abb494d5ee2b3816a7e840fb2c3caf55d63
Closes-bug: #1581592
"}]
commit_message:
Change logic for setting murano_hash for plugins

Fuel-web changes I8ebac4405a1eaede18a35acbbab7b202b6aac754 and
Ieaa373d52403b834aa17eeb05a70b37c61454ad0 changed location for
'murano_glance_artifacts_plugin' setting. It has been moved
from the 'additional_components' group to the 'murano_settings'
group, hence we need update library as well.

The most easier way is to change logic for setting murano_hash in
global task, then we don't need to change modular task at all.

Change-Id: I4af71abb494d5ee2b3816a7e840fb2c3caf55d63
Closes-bug: #1581592

Follow symlinks in cpio was deemed as a security risk so we
unable to build iso with the latest cpio package.

This patch introduce changes which allows to build iso both with
"old" cpio and the latest one by using --extract-over-symlinks
option

Co-author: Stefan K. Berg <stefan.k.berg@ericsson.com>

Change-Id: I2ac5a2e6255fae799ddff14bb3f97c270e3dba43
Closes-bug: #1573213
Related-bug: #1551092
'}]
commit_message:
Allow cpio to follow symlinks

Follow symlinks in cpio was deemed as a security risk so we
unable to build iso with the latest cpio package.

This patch introduce changes which allows to build iso both with
"old" cpio and the latest one by using --extract-over-symlinks
option

Co-author: Stefan K. Berg <stefan.k.berg@ericsson.com>

Change-Id: I2ac5a2e6255fae799ddff14bb3f97c270e3dba43
Closes-bug: #1573213
Related-bug: #1551092

commit_message:
Add the argument image into create_and_upload_volume_to_image

I think it is better to add the argument image to create_and_upload_volume_to_image.
Now possibly upload a empty volume to image, it is meaningless to the business.

The NetApp cDOT drivers have a check for user permissions
at startup time where they determine whether various APIs
needed by the storage service catalog may be used by the
current user context.  This code was taking ~6 seconds on
a lightly-loaded storage controller, which delayed driver
startup and occasionally caused Tempest failures because
the tests started running before the driver was ready.

Partially implements: blueprint replace-netapp-cdot-ssc-module

Change-Id: I0263bec06118edcbb0038b5ba319365f8e837508
'}]
commit_message:
NetApp: Rewrite user API discovery logic

The NetApp cDOT drivers have a check for user permissions
at startup time where they determine whether various APIs
needed by the storage service catalog may be used by the
current user context.  This code was taking ~6 seconds on
a lightly-loaded storage controller, which delayed driver
startup and occasionally caused Tempest failures because
the tests started running before the driver was ready.

Partially implements: blueprint replace-netapp-cdot-ssc-module

Change-Id: I0263bec06118edcbb0038b5ba319365f8e837508

commit_message:
Fix truncated hint text due to the limited length set in the field.

In magic-search, translated hint text is truncated because fixed value width is assigned for search-input class.
I changed search-input width 250px to 100%.

Change-Id: Ib34e6fe0736f4a6bdc639ec354a7d83242d32ef3
Closes-Bug: #1558939

commit_message:
Fix usage of old deployment task for controller deletion

When we remove the controller from cluster we need a redeployment of all
left controllers. Before this patch we always use tasks.DeploymentTask,
now if lcm supported we use tasks.ClusterTransaction​

Change-Id: Ia5a226221eae4f1d2ade3633bc32d22cdf24a3f2
Closes-Bug: #1578571
(cherry picked from commit f3fc1e9651fea4bc3564ee307e32461075a16607)

subject: Prevent failure on 'copy_configdrive_to_disk.sh'
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-17 21:11:53.000000000', 'files': ['ironic_python_agent/shell/copy_configdrive_to_disk.sh'], 'message': 'Prevent failure on 'copy_configdrive_to_disk.sh'

The script splits 'sfdisk' output wrongly in blank spaces leading to
failures when partition id is greater than 10, e.g.:
"/dev/sda10: start= ...".

This fix splits the output on ":" and trims trailing space when
partition id is less than 10, e.g.: "/dev/sda1 : start= ...".

Change-Id: I23f4b747fc0a86713cb912afc5d193398e6a597b
Closes-Bug: 1581699
'}]
commit_message:
Prevent failure on 'copy_configdrive_to_disk.sh'

The script splits 'sfdisk' output wrongly in blank spaces leading to
failures when partition id is greater than 10, e.g.:
"/dev/sda10: start= ...".

This fix splits the output on ":" and trims trailing space when
partition id is less than 10, e.g.: "/dev/sda1 : start= ...".

Change-Id: I23f4b747fc0a86713cb912afc5d193398e6a597b
Closes-Bug: 1581699

moves to detecting how the daemon is managed, and then

Fixes for IPv6 network address detection under Ubuntu
16.04 which changes the output format of the ip commands
slightly.

Fixup use of apt during unit tests and ensure that tox

better unit test isolation from host OS.

Closes-Bug: 1581171
Closes-Bug: 1581598
Closes-Bug: 1580674
"}]
commit_message:
Resync stable charm-helpers

Avoid use of 'service --status-all' which is currently
broken on trusty for upstart managed daemons; the change
moves to detecting how the daemon is managed, and then
using upstart status XXX or the return code of service XXX
status to determine whether a process is running.

Fixes for IPv6 network address detection under Ubuntu
16.04 which changes the output format of the ip commands
slightly.

Update the version map to include 8.1.x as a Neutron
version for Mitaka.

Fixup use of apt during unit tests and ensure that tox
virtualenvs don't make use of site packages, providing
better unit test isolation from host OS.

Change-Id: Ifdab07064db127239a35a16a5c4091759f3574d4
Closes-Bug: 1581171
Closes-Bug: 1581598
Closes-Bug: 1580674

commit_message:
Add public_endpoint parameter

public_endpoint allows to set URL to use when building the links to the API
resources.
If the API is operating behind a proxy, user will want to change this to
represent the proxy's URL.

Change-Id: Ic85497dd957cf1de738da728c1b0f5b87fecfb79

subject: Add net-config-static.yaml
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-04-12 11:32:32.000000000', 'files': ['net-config-static.yaml'], 'message': 'Add net-config-static.yaml

Add a new network config for configuring a static IP on a single
interface.  Similar to net-config-static-bridge.yaml, except that it
does not create a bridge and add the specificed interface to that
bridge.

Where net-config-static-bridge.yaml would be used as the controller
network config for the scenario of configuring a static IP,
net-config-static.yaml would be used for the compute node when you want
a static IP, but do not need a bridge.

Change-Id: Ide3be3b90fcf5e4b6045be3128dfb5c812fbb2e8
'}]
commit_message:
Add net-config-static.yaml

Add a new network config for configuring a static IP on a single
interface.  Similar to net-config-static-bridge.yaml, except that it
does not create a bridge and add the specificed interface to that
bridge.

Where net-config-static-bridge.yaml would be used as the controller
network config for the scenario of configuring a static IP,
net-config-static.yaml would be used for the compute node when you want
a static IP, but do not need a bridge.

Change-Id: Ide3be3b90fcf5e4b6045be3128dfb5c812fbb2e8

commit_message:
Update compute_driver in documentation

Nova doesn't support long driver names for compute_driver.
Replace long driver name 'nova.virt.ironic.IronicDriver' with short one
'ironic.IronicDriver'.

Reference:
https://review.openstack.org/309504/

Change-Id: I00713abd3c230a42380593ff39c238b448bc0732
(cherry picked from commit 682a0c2c983d99f1c305ce17db5b812ffe356fe1)

commit_message:
Use shutil.copy2 to preserve file stats in backup

To preserve file ownership and permissions in backup and
some other places, move from using shutil.copy to shutil.copy2.

Change-Id: I8f00834ab598267ccc54f18cea70d6db415ba69d
Closes-bug: 1572922
(cherry picked from commit 969c90144e468942d54bcc0ccc7fa820b7b4a0a1)

commit_message:
Remove Ceilometer tempest tests

Now Ceilometer and Aodh tempest plugins are implemented and all
tests and supported code is present in plugins.
-https://github.com/openstack/aodh/tree/master/aodh/tests/tempest
-https://github.com/openstack/ceilometer/tree/master/ceilometer/tests/tempest

NOTE- Need to keep config option 'CONF.service_available.ceilometer'
as it is being used in Congress tests in Kilo and Liberty branch and
Ceilometer tempest plugin is available since Mitaka.
If we remove that then, we will be breaking Congress gate for stable branches.

Change-Id: I0775bcc15dc9cbae6e075fe92f44b5f6c9b9d5d2
Depends-On: Ic0e6b72d8767d92cc63968c442c4ff65bb001cda

subject: Add missing ManagementIpSubnet
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-04-12 11:32:09.000000000', 'files': ['net-config-static-bridge.yaml'], 'message': 'Add missing ManagementIpSubnet

Change 15bb67261a333f140f21208e20a112b99eeb609c added the management
network, but the ManagementIpSubnet parameter was missed being added
net-config-static-bridge.yaml. This makes the template not work by
default since Heat will error when the parameter is passed in as a
property.  This adds the parameter which fixes the template.

Change-Id: Ie745103e596c9fe2d5562acfff157157be0ff0e2
'}]
commit_message:
Add missing ManagementIpSubnet

Change 15bb67261a333f140f21208e20a112b99eeb609c added the management
network, but the ManagementIpSubnet parameter was missed being added
net-config-static-bridge.yaml. This makes the template not work by
default since Heat will error when the parameter is passed in as a
property.  This adds the parameter which fixes the template.

Change-Id: Ie745103e596c9fe2d5562acfff157157be0ff0e2

commit_message:
Use wsgi from oslo.service for Ironic API

oslo.service provides a wsgi functionality for defining new long-running
services using by OpenStack applications. It might usefull for working with SSL for example.

Ironic has started migrate to oslo.service, this change continue this work, and consumes wsgi from it.

(cherry picked from commit c4bd20ebd4b42201bf40e00d4f0a1b2c69d2e932)

Change-Id: Ic7865709cd87c45e6b7d49f15ce73354aa15401e
Closes-Bug: #1484044

commit_message:
Remove link to Liberty configs

This removes the link to the Liberty configs from our documentation.
Our documentation should reflect what is on the master branch, but
since the configuration documentation is only available on a (named)
release basis, we should only link to the latest, which is Mitaka
configs.

Change-Id: I2d4c857dcbe3745ef8aad714600ea32c9762a628

commit_message:
Add tests for multipath devices

SSHManager.update_connection: add possibility to open new connection with
parameters, if no connection presents.

This testgroup should be run with this parameters:

    export MULTIPATH=True
    export SLAVE_MULTIPATH_DISKS_COUNT=2
    export MULTIPATH_TEMPLATE=system_test/tests_templates/tests_configs/multipath_3_nodes.yaml

Closes-Bug: 1582260

subject: Restrict falcon>=1.0.0
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-19 08:33:58.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': "Restrict falcon>=1.0.0

Recently falcon just released a new version 1.0.0, which drop a
support of hooks for rest api which is used in Zaqar. Now Zaqar
has fix it to use the middleware mechanism of falcon, which can't
work with falcon version<1.0.0. Now in OpenStack community only
Zaqar is using falcon, so the change is safe.

Change-Id: I027f9c0c4047c5f0ff9e20bbce7cbbf9be1ccbb1
"}]
commit_message:
Restrict falcon>=1.0.0

Recently falcon just released a new version 1.0.0, which drop a
support of hooks for rest api which is used in Zaqar. Now Zaqar
has fix it to use the middleware mechanism of falcon, which can't
work with falcon version<1.0.0. Now in OpenStack community only
Zaqar is using falcon, so the change is safe.

Change-Id: I027f9c0c4047c5f0ff9e20bbce7cbbf9be1ccbb1

subject: Use application/directory content-type for dir markers
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-04-09 00:10:57.000000000', 'files': ['tests/unit/test_service.py', 'swiftclient/service.py'], 'message': "Use application/directory content-type for dir markers

Previously, we were using a content-type of text/directory, but that is
already defined in RFC 2425 and doesn't reflect our usage:

   The text/directory Content-Type is defined for holding a variety
   of directory information, for example, name, or email address,
   or logo.

(From there it goes on to describe a superset of the vCard format
defined in RFC 2426.)

application/directory, on the other hand, is used by Static Web [1] and
is used by cloudfuse [2]. Seems like as sane a choice as any to
standardize on.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/swift/blob/2.5.0/swift/common/middleware/staticweb.py#L71-L75
[2] https://github.com/redbo/cloudfuse/blob/1.0/README#L105-L106

Change-Id: I19e30484270886292d83f50e7ee997b6e1623ec7
"}]
commit_message:
Use application/directory content-type for dir markers

Previously, we were using a content-type of text/directory, but that is
already defined in RFC 2425 and doesn't reflect our usage:

   The text/directory Content-Type is defined for holding a variety
   of directory information, for example, name, or email address,
   or logo.

(From there it goes on to describe a superset of the vCard format
defined in RFC 2426.)

application/directory, on the other hand, is used by Static Web [1] and
is used by cloudfuse [2]. Seems like as sane a choice as any to
standardize on.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/swift/blob/2.5.0/swift/common/middleware/staticweb.py#L71-L75
[2] https://github.com/redbo/cloudfuse/blob/1.0/README#L105-L106

Change-Id: I19e30484270886292d83f50e7ee997b6e1623ec7

commit_message:
Add policy checks in images panels

check policy of getting images in:
project/images
project/ngimages
admin/images

Only block listing images but not whole panel if failed on policy check.
Create, Delete and other actions are controlled by according policys.
give a message "Insufficient privilege level to get images." to user
if polciy checks failed.

Closes-Bug: #1529012
Change-Id: I97ab081425dd56fa7c3208efb58ba8b041eaba24

subject: log: max_spools
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-19 08:50:12.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_log/spool.py', 'oslo_log/tests/unit/test_spool.py'], 'message': 'log: max_spools

For full control over the memory footprint of spooling loggers, you
need to not only limit the size of each spool but the number of
spools. This can be done by simply exercising control over the number
requested, which is easy in the case of EG API workers. However if
you are set up to spawn a new worker per request, without limit,
having the spool manager rate-limit may be useful.

Change-Id: I14e38eabfff772c5fce0910806115137d8667ef2
'}]
commit_message:
log: max_spools

For full control over the memory footprint of spooling loggers, you
need to not only limit the size of each spool but the number of
spools. This can be done by simply exercising control over the number
requested, which is easy in the case of EG API workers. However if
you are set up to spawn a new worker per request, without limit,
having the spool manager rate-limit may be useful.

Change-Id: I14e38eabfff772c5fce0910806115137d8667ef2

subject: Change ping wait flag
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-10 00:32:55.000000000', 'files': ['validation-scripts/all-nodes.sh'], 'message': 'Change ping wait flag

This is an optimization of the ping command. It changes ping test
from waiting for a single sent packet for 300 seconds to waiting
to receive a packet from any number of sent packets. The current
implemenation waits for full 300 seconds before retrying if we
do not get a reply for the first packet sent. By using -w flag,
we keep sending icmp packets until a reply is sent, making the
ping test more responsive to connectivity change.

Change-Id: I01ab374ae44718c8d56e2d7f35812dfb5bb2ce5a
Signed-off-by: Feng Pan <fpan@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Change ping wait flag

This is an optimization of the ping command. It changes ping test
from waiting for a single sent packet for 300 seconds to waiting
to receive a packet from any number of sent packets. The current
implemenation waits for full 300 seconds before retrying if we
do not get a reply for the first packet sent. By using -w flag,
we keep sending icmp packets until a reply is sent, making the
ping test more responsive to connectivity change.

Change-Id: I01ab374ae44718c8d56e2d7f35812dfb5bb2ce5a
Signed-off-by: Feng Pan <fpan@redhat.com>

subject: Modify default sort in flavor table in ng-instance
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-10 07:51:58.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/static/dashboard/project/workflow/launch-instance/flavor/flavor.html'], 'message': "Modify default sort in flavor table in ng-instance

Default sort on the flavor table is specified as RAM (only the case
of available table). But at the moment, it doesn't work.
It is caused by undefined variables (isAvailableTable).
This variables seems to be a flag wheather a table is Allocated table
or Available table. However, these tables are implemented separately.
Thus, it doesn't need to use this variable. Therefore, this patch
will remove the condition using this variable.

Change-Id: I912850d352e547082bb25c5fced938d8cdc50dc9
Closes-Bug: #1580056
"}]
commit_message:
Modify default sort in flavor table in ng-instance

Default sort on the flavor table is specified as RAM (only the case
of available table). But at the moment, it doesn't work.
It is caused by undefined variables (isAvailableTable).
This variables seems to be a flag wheather a table is Allocated table
or Available table. However, these tables are implemented separately.
Thus, it doesn't need to use this variable. Therefore, this patch
will remove the condition using this variable.

Change-Id: I912850d352e547082bb25c5fced938d8cdc50dc9
Closes-Bug: #1580056

commit_message:
Whitelist 'rm' in pep8 tox environment

Running the pep8 environment currently warns that 'rm' is not
installed in testenv. This patch removes the warning by whitelisting
the rm command.

Change-Id: I822195990d345ddd08237f9696651c71ad59b9d2
Closes-Bug: #1583025

commit_message:
Restrict falcon version

falcon just released 1.0.0 and which is causing a backward
compatibility issue. So we need to restrict its version in master
branch.

Change-Id: Iabd1139e258449284ef93bcde514b5970a5ab199

revisions:

This patch promotes the infrastructure-related jobs on Xenial
in OpenStack-Ansible from experimental to non-voting. The
OpenStack roles are left as experimental for now as they rely

Change-Id: I3318b8db9e36384346fe4a7b153084df632e5efa

commit_message:
Promote OSA infrastructure Xenial/ jobs to non-voting

This patch promotes the infrastructure-related jobs on Xenial
in OpenStack-Ansible from experimental to non-voting. The
OpenStack roles are left as experimental for now as they rely
on the infrastructure roles for testing.

Change-Id: I3318b8db9e36384346fe4a7b153084df632e5efa

Use constants from neutron-lib

With this we enable the deprecation warnings by default.

Related-Blueprint: neutron-lib

subject: Fix two issues on k8s bay
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-19 04:15:19.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/templates/kubernetes/fragments/configure-kubernetes-minion.sh', 'magnum/templates/kubernetes/fragments/configure-kubernetes-master.sh', 'magnum/templates/kubernetes/fragments/kube-system-namespace-service.sh'], 'message': 'Fix two issues on k8s bay

After upgrade to Kubernetes v1.2, there are two issues:
* kubelet cannot find the IP address of nodes [1]
* the systemd service kube-system-namespace failed because it doesnot
  know the HOME environment variable. Similar issue from upstream
  is: https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/23975

This patch fixed them. First, set the HOME environment variable.
Second, override hostname with IP address.

[1] https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/23130

Change-Id: I55df72c8f36d81852bde36018c17670101860f79
Closes-Bug: #1582625
Closes-Bug: #1583415
'}]
commit_message:
Fix two issues on k8s bay

After upgrade to Kubernetes v1.2, there are two issues:
* kubelet cannot find the IP address of nodes [1]
* the systemd service kube-system-namespace failed because it doesnot
  know the HOME environment variable. Similar issue from upstream
  is: https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/23975

This patch fixed them. First, set the HOME environment variable.
Second, override hostname with IP address.

[1] https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/23130

Change-Id: I55df72c8f36d81852bde36018c17670101860f79
Closes-Bug: #1582625
Closes-Bug: #1583415

commit_message:
baseproxy: stop requiring CONF.verbose

Option "verbose" from group "DEFAULT" was deprecated for removal during
Mitaka, and has been removing during Newton.

It has been dropped by oslo.config and nova-novncproxy now fails to
start:
NoSuchOptError: no such option in group DEFAULT: verbose

This patch aims to stop requiring CONF.verbose that does not exist
anymore.

Change-Id: I9533666db73390f28656ffcb1e84fadd51321e91
Closes-Bug: #1582103

subject: Allow import command to set deploy image and local boot
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-05-17 13:03:24.000000000', 'files': ['tripleoclient/tests/v1/baremetal/test_baremetal.py', 'tripleoclient/v1/baremetal.py'], 'message': 'Allow import command to set deploy image and local boot

In our default flow we already have all the images uploaded by the time we
import the Ironic nodes. So we can make the "configure boot" command optional
by setting images and the local boot capability right during the import.

This change also introduces 2 more flags to opt-out from these changes:
--no-deploy-image will skip setting the deploy image
--instance-boot-option allows setting the boot_option capability explicitly
(it still requires changing flavors to match)

It's still possible to override the capabilities in the instackenv.json.

Change-Id: I00bbdff724ecfd6b840a74767617126734d7a32c
'}]
commit_message:
Allow import command to set deploy image and local boot

In our default flow we already have all the images uploaded by the time we
import the Ironic nodes. So we can make the "configure boot" command optional
by setting images and the local boot capability right during the import.

This change also introduces 2 more flags to opt-out from these changes:
--no-deploy-image will skip setting the deploy image
--instance-boot-option allows setting the boot_option capability explicitly
(it still requires changing flavors to match)

It's still possible to override the capabilities in the instackenv.json.

Change-Id: I00bbdff724ecfd6b840a74767617126734d7a32c

installed in testenv. This patch removes the warning by whitelisting
the rm command.

Closes-Bug: #1581778

commit_message:
Ignore SendEnv LC_* from ssh clients of master

If ssh client will send his Languange to server. They will be
accepted and in some cases it can cause breaking of python code.
To avoid unintended language settings let's ignore them.

Change-Id: Iabee9ef57244ea37972af16b1315118c349c30ac
Closes-bug: #1573638

Add DB retry decorator for DeadLock problem

This patch adds some retry logic so that DB APIs can be retried in face
of DeadLock situation.

commit_message:
remove FlavorCreateFailed exception

After flavors were objectified in
I86432720b600e479d8d8b7f7531a2c85ab364319 (2 years ago) the only place
that this exception was raised was removed from the code. This removes
all additional references to it in code and tests.

Change-Id: Ic848db8c3df75054c389e87b2405134262b531e2

commit_message:
Create separate task for uploading Murano package

When we have enabled Glare for Murano, Core library package will
be uploaded to current Glance backend - Swift or RadosGW - hence
we must be sure that both already prepared and ready to use.

Change-Id: If0a684aa9b0410e28a82b1501633c0ebdb64dc67
Closes-bug: #1572785

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-18 20:47:49.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/openstack_tasks/manifests/roles/compute.pp'], 'message': "Remove duplicate 'default_log_levels' declaration

Duplicate declaration 'default_log_levels' for the '::nova::logging'
produces an issue when nova-compute logs not created on the compute
nodes in case the 'debug' option is enabled during deployment. This
commit removes this duplication because it already declared in the
globals. Also, this commit contains some styling cleanups.

Closes-Bug: #1579072
Change-Id: Id24d742a6c7d9f1240bba7991959119d19084e94
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <mmalchuk@mirantis.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Remove duplicate 'default_log_levels' declaration

Duplicate declaration 'default_log_levels' for the '::nova::logging'
produces an issue when nova-compute logs not created on the compute
nodes in case the 'debug' option is enabled during deployment. This
commit removes this duplication because it already declared in the
globals. Also, this commit contains some styling cleanups.

Closes-Bug: #1579072
Change-Id: Id24d742a6c7d9f1240bba7991959119d19084e94
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <mmalchuk@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Enable Keystone API v3 by default in Cinder

'v3' url suffix was added to auth_uri, identity_uri to use
keystone api v3.

Implements: blueprint cinder-use-keystone-v3
Change-Id: Ia921a37aa31def21380d48e7aa244ead0de3f215

commit_message:
Consume upstream rabbitmq-server v3.6.1 OCF RA

* The package contains the OCF script now,
  remove it from Fuel's fuel-ha-utils.
* Rework the custom fuel rabbitmq-server OCF wrapper
  installation from the package, make it
  to invoke the upstream OCF RA from
  /usr/lib/ocf/resource.d/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-server-ha
* Address some of TODO/FIXME as well.

Related blueprint upstream-rabbit-ocf

Change-Id: Iaa401685eb5e8dc514809eec426b9e550de609ac
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

[{'number': 9, 'created': '2016-05-16 15:56:09.000000000', 'files': ['nova/db/sqlalchemy/api_models.py', 'nova/tests/functional/db/api/test_migrations.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/api_migrations/migrate_repo/versions/015_build_request_nullable_columns.py'], 'message': 'Make some build_requests columns nullable

Now that a serialized Instance object is being stored in the
build_requests table most of the other columns are no longer necessary
and should be deprecated. By first allowing them to be nullable they can
then be removed from the BuildRequest object and then removed in Ocata.

Also remove a UniqueConstraint that is no longer necessary.

Change-Id: I92fa2381c43e5e05d95bbcf9a7bb4306d3b3b856
Partially-implements: bp add-buildrequest-obj
'}]
commit_message:
Make some build_requests columns nullable

Now that a serialized Instance object is being stored in the
build_requests table most of the other columns are no longer necessary
and should be deprecated. By first allowing them to be nullable they can
then be removed from the BuildRequest object and then removed in Ocata.

Also remove a UniqueConstraint that is no longer necessary.

Change-Id: I92fa2381c43e5e05d95bbcf9a7bb4306d3b3b856
Partially-implements: bp add-buildrequest-obj

subject: Fix get task list on YAQL error in with-items
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-19 01:42:13.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/workflow/with_items.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/engine/test_with_items.py'], 'message': 'Fix get task list on YAQL error in with-items

If there is a YAQL error in with-items, the with_items_context is not
initialized and get task list from the API will failed with
"ERROR (app) 'with_items_context'". This patch fixes the data_flow
module and returns a default with_items_context dictionary if it
does not exist.

Change-Id: I2cc7d71f30dfad3122e06637a7583333cb02de6b
'}]
commit_message:
Fix get task list on YAQL error in with-items

If there is a YAQL error in with-items, the with_items_context is not
initialized and get task list from the API will failed with
"ERROR (app) 'with_items_context'". This patch fixes the data_flow
module and returns a default with_items_context dictionary if it
does not exist.

Change-Id: I2cc7d71f30dfad3122e06637a7583333cb02de6b

commit_message:
fix the limit of injected file content length is incorrect problem

As createServer API required, the content should be base64 encoded
string and the content length limit is the limit of base64 decoded raw
data, not the base64 encoded data.

Change-Id: Ia917632b09884ea1d7a3040c10559865992a7c07
Closes-Bug: #1550671
